intro: Oldenlandia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
